conclusion: Principle of magnetic induction relates magnetic field intensity B to current I and magnetic force F on the wire.
Magnetic force formula: F = IBL, where I is current, B is magnetic field intensity, and L is length of the wire.
Identify given values: Current I = 1 A, Reading of first scale F1 = 10 N, Current I = 2 A, Reading of second scale F2 = 20 N.
Use magnetic force formula F = IBL to find magnetic field intensity B.
Substitute known values into formula: 10 = 1 x B x 10.
Since B is constant, ratio of magnetic forces F1/F2 = 1/2.
Since magnetic force is inversely proportional to square of distance from wire, ratio of magnetic fields B1/B2 = 1/2.
Since B2 = 20, magnetic field intensity B is 20.
